intro: Antegibbaeum, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with fleshy, often blue-green leaves that store water. Its flowers are typically small, five-petaled, and appear in clusters during the rainy season. Antegibbaeum is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy plant for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
